editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: GALEN, ARNAUD DE VILLENEUVE &c.; S. XIV

msItem.author: JORDANUS RUFUS OF CALABRIA
msItem.title: Veterinary Medicine
msItem.incipit: Cum inter cetera alia usui hominis deputata equus sit nobilius
msItem.explicit: nisi per se prius ceciderint. Explicit.
msItem.finalRubric: Hoc egit immensis studiis nacione Lucensis / Qui bene cunctorum medicinas nouit equorum.

msItem.title: 'TROTULA', De Morbis Mulierum
msItem.incipit: Cum auctor uniuersitatis Deus in prima mundi constitucione
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber factus a muliere Salernitana que Trotula uocatur.
msItem.note: Often printed; eTK 0284J; M. H. Green, ‘The development of the Trotula’, Revue d’histoire des textes 26 (1996), 119–203; idem, ‘A handlist of the Latin and vernacular manuscripts of the so-called Trotula’, Scriptorium 50 (1996), 137–75, this copy at p. 162 (no. 78).

msItem.title: De Morbis Puerorum
msItem.incipit: Passiones et morbos puerorum adhuc in cunabulis iacentium
msItem.note: Ed. K. Sudhoff, Erstlinge der pädiatrischen Literatur (Munich, 1925), pp. xxxix-xlii (text pp. xli-xlii), copies including this one discussed at p. xl.

msItem.author: IOHANNES STEPHANUS
msItem.title: De Febribus
msItem.incipit: Contra coleram rubeam siue sit causon siue terciana
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus febrium magistri Iohannis Stephani.

msItem.author: WALTER AGILON
msItem.title: De dosibus medicinarum
msItem.incipit: Medicinarum quedam sunt simplices quedam composite

msItem.author: DOMINICUS GUNDISSALINVS
msItem.title: De ortu scientiarum
msItem.incipit: Cum plures essent olim philosophi inter omnes tamen ille solus sapiens
msItem.note: Ed. M. Alonso Alonso, Domingo Gundisalvo, De Scientiis (Madrid-Granada, 1954), pp. 55–140; eTK 0330H, there wrongly ascr. Kilwardby; Diaz 1019.

msItem.author: ARNALDUS DE VILLANOVA
msItem.title: De Phlebotomia
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri Arnaldi de Villa noua de flebotomia siue de considerationibus medicorum.
msItem.incipit: Virtutem querimonie tue percipientes nuper tibi beatissime significauimus
Cum artifex medicine intendit aliquod opus excercere in corpore
msItem.note: Pr. Venice 1505 &c.; Glorieux, Théol. 211br, not this copy.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Rigore et Tremore et Iectigatione et Spasmo
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de rigore et timore et iectigacione et spasmo translatus Barchinone a magistro Arnaldo de Villa noua.
msItem.incipit: Quoniam Anaxagoras filius Anchalis qui fuit unus de peritis in rebus naturalibus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber G. de rigore et tremore.
msItem.note: Ed. M. R. McVaugh, Arnaldus de Villanova, Opera Medica Omnia, 16 (Barcelona, 1981); Glorieux, Théol. 211b, not this copy; eTK 1260E; Diaz 1607.

msItem.author: ROGER BACON
msItem.title: Epistola de Secretis Operibus Artis et Naturae
msItem.note: Ed. J. S. Brewer, Fratris Rogeri Bacon Opera hactenus inedita (RS, 1859), pp. 523–51; Little, no. 18; Glorieux, Théol. 312ac.

msItem.title: De Cibariis
msItem.rubric: Incipit summula de purgacione ciborum et potum infirmorum secundum Musandum.
msItem.incipit: De cibis et potibus preparandis infirmis uideamus
msItem.explicit: iocunda etiam in quibus delectetur multum iuuant. Explicit.
msItem.note: Pr. Arnaldi Villanovani ... praxis medicinalis (Lyon 1586), pp. 177–80; Glorieux, Théol. 211o (as by Arnaldus de Villanova); eTK 0367H; Diaz 1613.

msItem.author: ARNALDUS DE VILLANOVA
msItem.title: De intentione medicorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri Arnaldi de Villa noua de intencione medicorum.
msItem.incipit: Iam nos alibi sepe dixisse recolimus quod intencio artificis medicine ad unicum finem principalem ordinatur
msItem.explicit: cum laude Dei iubemus hic feliciter terminari. Explicit.
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, Lyon 1504, fols. 167–74v; Glorieux, Théol. 211i; eTK 0526L, 1407A.

msItem.author: ARNALDUS DE VILLANOVA
msItem.title: Epistola de reprobatione negromanticae fictionis
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola magistri Arnaldi de Villa noua ad Valentinum episcopum de reprobatione nigromantice fictionis.
msItem.incipit: Iudiciis desiderii uestri collectis nuper magnifice pater
msItem.note: Glorieux, Théol. 211bz; eTK 0801H, 1357K; ed. P. Diepgen, Archiv für Kulturgeschichte 9 (1912), 386–403, text from p. 387.

msItem.author: ARNALDUS DE VILLANOVA
msItem.title: Commentary on GALEN, De Malitia Complexionis Diuersae
msItem.incipit: Intendit G. in hoc tractatu ostendere quomodo malicia complexionis diuerse introducatur
msItem.note: Pr. in his Opera, Lyon 1504, fols. 351v-71v; Glorieux, Théol. 211k.

msItem.author: ARNALDUS DE VILLANOVA
msItem.title: Aphorismi de Gradibus
msItem.incipit: In medicinis per artem compositis consideratis
Illi ergo regratulari conuenit tota tante qui uiuit
Incipit tabula prima de porcionibus qualitatum in quolibet situ principali
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber magistri Arnaldi de Villa noua de graduacionibus medicinarum.
msItem.note: Ed. M. R. McVaugh, in Arnaldus de Villanova, Opera Medica Omnia, 2 (Granada and Barcelona, 1975); Glorieux, Théol. 211f.

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: De Interioribus
msItem.rubric: Incipit doctrina G. de interioribus secundum stilum latinorum.
msItem.note: Ed. R. J. Durling, Galen Latinus 2 (Stuttgart, 1992).

supportDesc.extent:
112 leaves of parchment prepared in the Italian manner (ii + 110) 305 205
225–35 145
The edges retrimmed removing running heads, and spattered with red. Early foliation in roman numerals, mostly cropped: the highest surviving number is 76 (mod. f. 62).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 53 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Probably a single French scribe, though variable, writing rather rough gothic rotunda bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: None: unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics, which are supplied occasionally; underlining in red.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. ff. i-ii, 110–11 are paper binding leaves, the outermost from the same printed book as in MS 11. On f. 1, near the foot of the foredge, is the mark of an iron chain-staple. Another mark further up may be from a central strap.

history.provenance: It is not known when this book entered the College prior to s. xvii. However, McVaugh (edn. of art. 8, p. 43 n. 78) believes that it may correspond to the ‘libros Arnaldi de Villa nova’ named in Simon Bredon’s will (Powicke, p. 84).
At the head of f. 1 is ‘Lucensis’, s. xvii.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘P. 2. 13 Art:’ (not in the usual hand), and modern ‘N. 1. 3 (CCXXX)’ in red; the College bookplate. ‘13’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
